title: On Quantum Radiation in Curved Spacetime
abstract: In the context of quantum field theories for fermions and bosons in curved spacetime, we compute the effective action of the transition amplitude from vacuum to vacuum in the presence of an external gravitational field. The imaginary part of resulted effective action determines the probability of vacuum decay via quantum tunneling process, giving the rate and spectrum of particle creations. On the basis that gravitational field polarizes vacuum and discretizes its spectrum, we discuss the quantum origin of such a tunneling effect and spectrum of particle creations.
